intro: Guichenotia alba, commonly known as white guichenotia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, often in sandy or rocky soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces pods that contain small, round seeds. Guichenotia alba is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
